title: MD
biography: Ryōji Noyori  is a Japanese chemist. He won the Nobel Prize in Chemistry in 2001, Noyori shared a half of the prize with William S. Knowles for the study of chirally catalyzed hydrogenations; the second half of the prize went to K. Barry Sharpless for his study in chirally catalyzed oxidation reactions.
aiSummary: Ryoji Noyori is a medicinal chemistry specialist with an H-index of 122 at Nagoya University (Member). Has been published in Science, Nature. Based in Unknown, Unknown, Global.
